result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenton S Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brenton S Davis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brenton S Davis was found guilty of Injury by Use/Vehicle-Control. Substance, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(am).
  • Brenton S Davis was found guilty of Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$628.0018 restitution amount is incorrect.
Correct restitution amount is $628.18, payable to State Department of Justice; and $4,748.90 to Dominique M.  
Restitution to Martesa H. to be determined on next Court date.
**04-07-16/Rest. Hearing for Martest H. proceeded. Court sets restitution in the amount of $9,513.74 payable to Martesa H.

Provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge.  
Court costs and all applicable surcharges, assessments are waived due to large amount of restitution owed.
DNA surcharge AND restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison  funds. Balance to be paid during the term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment.  Obtain GED or HSED.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
No operation of motor vehicles without a valid drivers license.

Cooperate with agent.
Coperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of Extended Supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. jbs
on count one.
Return of petition for sentence adjustment on count 4 (defendant served all the confinement time).

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing MARCH 3, 2016 received and filed. (21 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Brenton S Davis not in court, in custody.  Thomas Potter for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution for Martesa H. proceeded.  Court sets restitution in the amount of $9,513.74 payable to Martesa H.   Restitution amount to be collected from up to 25% of prison funds; remaining balance to be collected during term of extended supervison; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Per DOC request, restitution amount corrected from $628.0018 to $628.18
Associated with Charge #1/Corrected to show 2 yr revocation period as ordered at sentencing
Per my clerical error/typo. Credit on count four showing 310 days (not 210 days).

Defendant Brenton S Davis in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Brenton S Davis in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, with credit for 310 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $628.18 payable to State Department of Justice; $4,784.90 to Dominique M., to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to Martesa H. to be determined on next Court date.  
-Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are WAIVED due to large amount of restitution owed.  
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment  
-Obtain GED or HSED
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Revocation of defendant's driving privileges for 2 years
-No operation of motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 1, with credit for 310 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $628.18 payable to 
State Department of Justice; $4,784.90 to Dominique M., to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to Martesa H. to be determined on next Court date.  
-Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are WAIVED due to large amount of restitution owed.  
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment  
-Obtain GED or HSED
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Revocation of defendant's driving privileges for 2 years
-No operation of motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit Sheet

Defendant Brenton S Davis in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Brenton S Davis in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, COUNT 1 shall be amended to Injury By Intoxicated Use of Vehicle (Great Bodily Harm - Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance) pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 940.25(1)(am), 939.50(3)(f), COUNT 2 shall be amended to Injury by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle (Great Bodily Harm - Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance) pursuant to Wisc. Stats 940.25(1)(am), 939.50(3)(f), COUNT 5 shall be amended to Operate with Detectable Amount of Restricted Controlled Substance in Blood Causing Injury (1st Offense) a Misdemeanor; and COUNTS 2 and 5 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNTS 1 and 4, and COUNT 3 DISMISSED.   Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST in COUNTS 1 and 5.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brenton S Davis in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Brenton S Davis in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Brenton S Davis not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs the Court that the Delta 9 drug report was received today.  These records need to be reviewed.  Matter scheduled for a "soft" plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defense motion to amend the bail heard and denied.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Brenton S Davis not in court, in custody.  Franco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Blood results are not available as of the date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brenton S Davis in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Brenton S Davis in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Parties are waiting for addional test results.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
two victim impact statements, received and filed

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court appearing via telephone, defendant Brenton S Davis not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone. Defense counsel is ill and cannot appear in person. Defense requested an adjournment. State does not object.  Case adjourned to Branch 22.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Brenton S Davis not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brenton S Davis in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Brenton S Davis in custody.  Marissa Santiago for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by  portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Brenton S Davis in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Brenton S Davis in custody.  
Katryna L. Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
